alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PASSAIC...NORTHWESTERN BERGEN... NORTHWESTERN ESSEX...ORANGE AND ROCKLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Howells to Florida to Hamburg to Hopatcong to Allamuchy-Panther Valley. Movement was east at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paterson, Wayne, Middletown, West Milford, Ridgewood, Monsey, Ramsey, Ringwood, Pompton Lakes, Suffern, Port Jervis, Monroe, Caldwell, West Point, and Warwick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern New Jersey...and southeastern New York.
